text: - Hi, I'm Douglas Park,

Senior Specialized Solution
Architect for Amazon Connect.

In this video, I will talk
about how Amazon Connect Chat
makes it easy to deliver
superior digital customer experiences

by providing unified, omnichannel
tools and capabilities.

Amazon Connect Chat allows
contact centers to build one time

and deliver consistent
customer experiences
across voice and chat channels.
Agents provide efficient customer service
with Amazon Connect Chat

by using one platform to manage
their customer interactions
and move seamlessly between them.
Finally, Amazon Connect Chat
gives contact center managers

a holistic view into
key operational insights
across their different service channels.

Omnichannel solutions
offer the same experience
across all channels.
And Amazon Connect allows you
to replicate the same contact flows
and conversational AI bots
for both chat and voice interactions.

If you build a bot in
Amazon Lex for your IVR,
you can use that same bot in the chat
from your mobile app or website.

For end customers, the experience
is unified and seamless.

Amazon Connect Chat allows
customers to start a conversation
from any capable business application.
The experience is asynchronous.

Meaning customers can chat
with a chatbot or agent

when it's convenient for
them, switch devices,

and then resume the conversation
without losing context.

Amazon Lex, AWS's natural
language understanding service,
provides a native integration with chat,

requires no coding to
add NLU-powered chatbots,
self-service experiences,
and for the context of those conversations
to be passed automatically,
if escalated to a human agent.
Let me show you how this looks for agents
and contact center managers,
and explore the types of experiences
you can create for your customers.
Agents have a single-user interface

to help customers using
both voice and chat.

This reduces the number of
tools that agents have to learn

and the number of applications
they have to interact

with while helping customers
across multiple channels.
With voice and chat in one platform,

you can easily cross-train
agents using one UI

and seamlessly move
agents between channels
based on contact volume spikes.

Chat activities integrate with
your existing contact flows

and the automation that
you've built for voice.
You build your flows once
and reuse them across multiple channels.
Likewise, for metrics collection
and the dashboards you built,

they automatically benefit
from the unified metrics
across multiple channels.

With Amazon Lex natively
integrated within Amazon Connect,
no coding is required for adding chatbots
that have natural language understanding,
and for the context of conversations
to be passed automatically
when escalated to a human agent.

Amazon Connect Chat supports
asynchronous messaging

so your customers and agents
have the ability to message
without being available at the same time.
Chats are secure and encrypted
and support all existing Amazon Connect
compliance certifications.

Amazon Connect also
offers native integration
with Apple Business Chat,
enabling your agents to support customers

through the same popular
iOS messaging application
that they use every day.

Management for Apple
Business Chat is easy,
because it uses Amazon Connect
contact flows' configuration and routing.
To support your customers through chat,
you can add a chat widget to your website
that is hosted by Amazon Connect.
You can configure the chat widget
in the Amazon Connect console,
customize the font and colors,
and secure the widget

so that it can be launched
only from your website.

As a result, you will
have a short code snippet
that you can add to your website.
Because Amazon Connect hosts the widget,

it ensures that it is always
at the latest version.
Within your Amazon Connect instance,

you can create and test your
own chat experience right away.
You can reuse an existing contact flow,
possibly create it for a voice contact,
or create a new one.
You can make use of an Amazon Lex chatbot
with full or partial automation,
or just to extract additional information
from the customer.
To test your experience,

navigate back to the dashboard
and click on Test Chat.

You can select the contact
flow you wish to test
in the Test Settings options,
as well as defining other parameters.

You can now click on the Chat
button in the sample website
and test your experience

all the way through to
the agent interaction.
Once you are satisfied,
you can customize your chat widget

and go live with Amazon Connect
Chat on your own website.

By using the same contact
flows for voice and chat,
routing and reporting is now centralized
and contact center managers

can get a full view of agent
occupancy and productivity.
For the builders out there

who want complete control
of the chat experience,
including hosting your own chat widget,
Amazon Connect provides a chat API

that enables you to
craft a unique experience
for your customers and your agents.

Amazon Connect Chat provides
open APIs for easy integration
with other contact center applications

that are critical to the
customer and agent experience.

With Amazon Connect, customers
always own their own data

and always have secure,
hassle-free access to that data.
We hope you've enjoyed this demonstration
of Amazon Connect Chat.
For more information,
check out our website at aws.com/connect.
(gentle music)
